contextId.information: This can be reworded so that the abstract nouns "wisdom" and "instruction" can be stated as adjectives or verbs. AT: "to teach you how to be wise and to instruct you about how to live moral lives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This can be reworded so that the abstract noun "wisdom" can be stated as the adjective "wise." This can also be stated in active form. AT: "also teach to those who are naive how to be wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: are also to give wisdom to the naive

contextId.information: The abstract nouns "fear," "beginning," and "knowledge" can be stated as verbs. AT: "You must first fear Yahweh in order to begin to know what is wise" or "You must first honor and respect Yahweh in order to learn what is wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge

contextId.information: The abstract noun "knowledge" can be stated as the verb "learn." AT: "Because they refused to learn to be wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This abstract noun can be stated as an adjective. AT: "listen to the wise things I am teaching you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract word "wisdom' refers to what a wise person believes and to the way in which he acts. AT: "learn how a wise person acts" or "learn what it means to be wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The words "fear" and "wisdom" can be translated with verbal phrases. AT: "When one fears Yahweh, he will learn to be wise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom

contextId.information: This is a name that refers to Yahweh. This is also an abstract noun that can be written as a verb. AT: "the one who made him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "rebellion" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "seeks to rebel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

The abstract noun "violence" refers to violent deeds or things people do to harm their innocent neighbors. The word "wicked" is a nominal adjective that can be translated as a noun phrase, "wicked people." AT: "The violent acts wicked people do to harm their innocent neighbors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

The abstract noun "justice" can be translated as a noun phrase. These words can be translated in active form. AT: "When rulers do what is just" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The abstract noun "hearing" can be translated as a verb. AT: "where a fool can hear you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: in the hearing of a fool

contextId.information: The abstract noun "instruction" can be translated as a verb. AT: "Do not neglect to instruct a child" or "Do not refuse to instruct a child" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Do not withhold instruction from a child

contextId.information: The abstract noun "wisdom" can be translated as an adjective. These words can be translated in active form. AT: "People need to be wise if they are to build a good house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Through wisdom a house is built

contextId.information: The abstract noun "knowledge" can be translated as a verb. These words can be translated in active form. AT: "People need to know what is precious and pleasant if they are to fill their rooms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: By knowledge the rooms are filled

contextId.information: The abstract noun "wisdom" can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "wise warrior" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "rebuke" can be expressed with the verb "rebuke." AT: "It is better to be openly rebuked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "transgression" can be translated as a verb. AT: "Because of how a land transgresses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Because of the transgression of a land

contextId.information: The abstract noun "reverence" can be expressed as an adjective. AT: "lives a reverent life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "understanding" can be translated as a verb. AT: "The ruler who does not understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "justice" can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "by doing what is just" or "by making just laws" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "transgression" can be translated as a verb. AT: "more people will transgress and their sins will become worse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "poverty" can be translated as an adjective. AT: "how poor he is" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
